[TITLE]
<line: 4> MINUTE ORDER

[TEXT]
<line: 6> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 7> CIVIL NO. 17-00446 LEK-RT

[TEXT]
<line: 9> Luis C. Chavez vs. Deutsch Bank National Trust Company et
<line: 10> al., 

[ABANDON]
<line: 12> CASE NAME:

[TEXT]
<line: 14> JUDGE:
<line: 15> Leslie E. Kobayashi
<line: 16> DATE:
<line: 17> 8/27/2020

[TITLE]
<line: 19> COURT ACTION: EO: COURT ORDER GRANTING DEFENDANTS’ EX PARTE
<line: 20> MOTION TO EXCEED PAGE LIMIT FOR MEMORANDUM IN SUPPORT OF
<line: 21> DEFENDANTS’ MOTION FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 23> The dispositive motions deadline is August 28, 2020.  See Minutes, filed 7/17/20
<line: 24> (dkt. no. 112).  On August 25, 2020, Defendants Deutsche Bank National Trust Company,
<line: 25> as Trustee for American Home Mortgage Assets Trust 2007-3, Mortgage-Backed Pass-
<line: 26> Through Certificates Series 2007-3, erroneously sued as “Deutsche Bank National Trust
<line: 27> Company”; Ocwen Loan Servicing, LLC; and Homeward Residential, Inc., formerly
<line: 28> known as American Home Mortgage Servicing, Inc (collectively “Defendants”), filed an
<line: 29> ex parte motion seeking leave to exceed the twenty-five page limit for the memorandum
<line: 30> in support of the motion for summary judgment that they intend to file (“Ex Parte
<line: 31> Motion”).  [Dkt. no. 122.]  The Ex Parte Motion asks that the Court extend the page limit
<line: 32> for both the memorandum in support and the memorandum in opposition to thirty-five
<line: 33> pages.  [Ex Parte Motion at 2.]  Defendants represent that Plaintiff Luis C. Chavez,
<line: 34> Individually and as Special Administrator of the Estate of Macario Araujo Chavez
<line: 35> (“Plaintiff”), does not object to the Defendants’ request.  [Id. at 1.]

[TEXT]
<line: 37> The Ex Parte Motion is GRANTED for the reasons stated therein.  Defendants’
<line: 38> memorandum in support of their motion for summary judgment and Plaintiff’s
<line: 39> memorandum in opposition shall not exceed thirty-five pages.  The fifteen-page limit for
<line: 40> the optional reply memorandum remains in effect.  See Local Rule LR7.4(c).

[TEXT]
<line: 42> Upon the filing of the motion for summary judgment, the Court will determine
<line: 43> whether to set the motion for hearing or to issue non-hearing briefing deadlines.  If the
<line: 44> motion for summary judgment is set for hearing, the filing deadlines set forth in Local
<line: 45> Rule 7.2 will apply.

[TEXT]
<line: 47> IT IS SO ORDERED.

[TEXT]
<line: 49> Submitted by: Agalelei Elkington, Courtroom Manager
